<<<api>>>: JSONArray, JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str);
for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++) {
  JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
  Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
  while (keys.hasNext()) {
    String key = keys.next();
    JSONArray values = jsonObject.getJSONArray(key);
    String name = key;
    String value = values.getString(0);
    String stock = values.getString(1);
    // create Fruit object and set the values
    Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
    fruit.setName(name);
    fruit.setValue(value);
    fruit.setStock(stock);
    // do something with the fruit object
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: First, create a JSONArray from the string received from the request parameter. Then, iterate through the JSONArray using a for loop. For each JSONObject in the JSONArray, get the keys using the keys() method and iterate through them using a while loop. Inside the while loop, get the values for each key using the getJSONArray() method. Extract the name, value, and stock from the values JSONArray and create a Fruit object. Set the values of the Fruit object using the setter methods and perform any further operations with the Fruit object as needed.

<<<api>>>: JSONArray, JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str);
for(int i=0; i<jsonArray.length(); i++) {
    JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
    Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
    while(keys.hasNext()) {
        String key = keys.next();
        JSONArray values = jsonObject.getJSONArray(key);
        String name = key;
        String value = values.getString(0);
        String stock = values.getString(1);
        // Create Fruit object and set the values
        Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
        fruit.setName(name);
        fruit.setValue(value);
        fruit.setStock(stock);
        // Do something with the Fruit object
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: First, create a JSONArray object from the string parameter using JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str). Then, iterate through the jsonArray using a for loop. Inside the loop, get the JSONObject at each index using JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i). Use the keys() method to get an Iterator of the keys in the JSONObject. Iterate through the keys using a while loop and get the JSONArray values for each key using JSONArray values = jsonObject.getJSONArray(key). Finally, create a Fruit object, set the values, and do something with it.

<<<api>>>: JSONArray, JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str);
for(int i=0; i<jsonArray.length(); i++){
  JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
  Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
  while(keys.hasNext()){
    String key = keys.next();
    JSONArray values = jsonObject.getJSONArray(key);
    String name = key;
    String value = values.getString(0);
    String stock = values.getString(1);
    // Create Fruit object and set the values
    Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
    fruit.setName(name);
    fruit.setValue(value);
    fruit.setStock(stock);
    // Do something with the Fruit object
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: First, create a JSONArray object from the string parameter. Then, iterate through the JSONArray using a for loop. Inside the loop, get each JSONObject from the JSONArray. Get the keys of the JSONObject using the keys() method. Iterate through the keys using a while loop. Inside the while loop, get the JSONArray corresponding to the current key. Extract the name, value, and stock values from the JSONArray. Create a Fruit object and set the values. Finally, you can do something with the Fruit object as per your requirement.

<<<api>>>: JSONArray, JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str);
for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++) {
    JSONObject obj = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
    Iterator<String> keys = obj.keys();
    while (keys.hasNext()) {
        String key = keys.next();
        JSONArray values = obj.getJSONArray(key);
        String setName = key;
        String setValue = values.getString(0);
        String setStock = values.getString(1);
        // Create Fruit object and pass the values
        Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
        fruit.setName(setName);
        fruit.setValue(setValue);
        fruit.setStock(setStock);
        // Do something with the fruit object
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: First, create a JSONArray object from the string parameter. Then, iterate through the JSONArray using a for loop. Inside the loop, get the JSONObject at each index. Get the keys of the JSONObject using an Iterator. For each key, get the JSONArray value and extract the values using getString(). Finally, create a Fruit object and pass the values to the appropriate setters.

<<<api>>>: JSONArray, JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONArray array = new JSONArray(str);
for(int i=0; i<array.length(); i++) {
    JSONObject object = array.getJSONObject(i);
    Iterator<String> keys = object.keys();
    while(keys.hasNext()) {
        String key = keys.next();
        JSONArray values = object.getJSONArray(key);
        String name = key;
        String value = values.getString(0);
        String stock = values.getString(1);
        
        // Create a Fruit object and set its values
        Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
        fruit.setName(name);
        fruit.setValue(value);
        fruit.setStock(stock);
        
        // Do something with the Fruit object
        // ...
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: First, parse the string into a JSONArray. Then, iterate through each item in the array using a for loop. For each item, get the JSONObject and iterate through its keys using an iterator. Get the key, which is the name of the fruit, and get the JSONArray of values. Extract the value and stock from the JSONArray. Create a Fruit object and set its values using the extracted data. Finally, you can do something with the Fruit object, such as passing it to another class.
